text:
Hey everyone, I've found a bad positional argument inside the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb|HubDB API> POST documentation for Python. It seems the doc passes the API response like this:

    `api_response = client.cms.hubdb.tables_api.create_table(hub_db_table_v_3_request=hub_db_table_v_3_request)`

But according to the HubSpot create_table() function string it should be passed like this:
`api_response = client.cms.hubdb.tables_api.create_table(hub_db_table_v_3_request)`
> Without the "`hub_db_table_v_3_request=`", otherwise it would generate a *TypeError: create_table() missing 1 required positional argument: 'hub_db_table_v3_request'*
The HubDB POST API for Python needs to be updated

hi all, my client is an e-scooter repair shop that uses HubSpot for marketing, sales pipeline and CRM reasons.
this is their ask:
"Can we make a simple page where the clients can see their HS properties publicly (like deal stage, total amount, ...) through the HS API key and print this page as a QR code and stick it to scooters = so that the whole team can have access to all this info in the warehouse where scooters are stored. We want to avoid having to look through Whatsapp chats to find info"

Is this sort of thing possible? Can someone please help me out? There might be a possibility to introduce you to this client and work on this project.

Hi

Got a question about HubSpot nodejs api docs

Docs mention that you can add both apiKey and developerApiKey to single client instance as per

const HubSpotClient = new HubSpot.Client({ apiKey: YOUR_API_KEY, developerApiKey: YOUR_DEVELOPER_API_KEY })

How does the client know to send api request to dev or production? That part is not clear in the docs so far
This is a stupid question, I’m sure… But how do you set a contact’s PRIMARY company that they are associated with??
